snippet: In the Wanamaker Mile at the New York meet, a chief source of interest is whether Lagat, an eight-time winner, can post a time under 3:58.15, breaking the record for runners 40 and older.
abstract: Bernard Lagat, who has won Wanamaker Mile at Millrose Games a record eight times, will be striving to break another record when 2015 Games convene in New York; should he complete race in under 3 minutes and 58.15 seconds, Lagat would break world record for runners 40 and older, set in 1994 by Eamonn Coghlan.
lead_paragraph: In the Wanamaker Mile at the New York meet, a chief source of interest is whether Lagat, an eight-time winner, can post a time under 3:58.15, breaking the record for runners 40 and older.

headline.seo: Bernard Lagat Hopes to Break Eamonn Coghlan’s Age-Group Record
headline.main: Lagat, 40, Seeks Different Kind of Millrose Triumph
headline.print_headline: Lagat, 40, Seeks Different Kind of Millrose Triumph
